channel.title: Windows cannot find 'java'..?
channel.description: Soooo i had wanted to turn the source on that i had gotton and run a little beta test for a friend and i, I hid all the files and such in the client folder and then i .rar'd it. he tryed to open up run.bat and he got this message [IMG]http://i39.tinypic.com/mcq24l.png[/img] obviously i'm doing something wrong idk if it's my variables or what but if anyone could help i'd appreciate it! if you can skype message me on here!

item.title: Windows cannot find 'java'..?
item.dc:creator: @kronixz kronikz
item.description:
@kronixz wrote:

no just replace “START java” with what I gave you

include the quotations though. " and the end " stay with it

So your saying replace “START java -xmx51’2m GUI 30 0 lowem members 32” with the code you just have me?

item.title: Windows cannot find 'java'..?
item.dc:creator: @xx_pwns_xx xx pwns xx
item.description:
@xx_pwns_xx wrote:

Another question, I found the download for the jar program, I followed the Tut and it didn’t do anything to the file… Now when I jar client files do I keep them all in the folder or hide everything else except “run”? And another question… And please excuse the noobness, but what exactly does a jar file do? How does it go around not having to set enriomental variables?

Read full topic

item.title: Windows cannot find 'java'..?
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

That was exactly what I was asking for.
The issue is:
STARTjava -Xmx512m Gui 30 0 lowmem members 32
Its usually because they don’t have environmental variables set, but a realistically easy solution would be to just jar your client, so it will open with the users default java version they have installed.

Read full topic

item.title: Windows cannot find 'java'..?
item.dc:creator: @xx_pwns_xx xx pwns xx
item.description:
@xx_pwns_xx wrote:

@echo off
color c
echo Running Instascape
Title Client
START java -Xmx512m Gui 30 0 lowmem members 32
exit

idk if this is what you’re asking for but this was in my run.bat in the client folder.

Read full topic
